Class MainLogicHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • MainLogicHandler

  • public class MainLogicHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class for the program. It does all of the basic logic handling for the program. This includes:
  • the Main method to use as a command line driver using one argument
  • reading and writing to files
  • stripping the file of blank lines and comments
  • formatting the output log with an appropriate header and footer
  • keeping track of how many errors occured and for what type
  • writing errors and warnings to the output log

    The main method requires one argument that is the name of the .mal file to read in (without the .mal extension). The program will save the output log to the same name with a .log extension.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Trever Mock

    • Constructor Detail

      • MainLogicHandler

        public MainLogicHandler(java.lang.String inputPath,
                java.lang.String outputPath)
        Constructor that handles all of the logic behind reading from the input file and writing to the output file. It strips the file of any comments and blank spaces and keeps track of the appropriate information to write an appropriate header and footer to the output log.
        Parameters:
        inputPath - - the path to the .mal input file
        outputPath - - the path to the .log output file

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method that takes in one argument as a String path. It creates a MainLogicHandler object using that path as the basis for an input and output file.
        Parameters:
        args - - path to a .mal file without the .mal extension
